page.title: 15FARMING..EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Mr.Ostler and his son work the farm with one full time employee ( 20 years ago there were 6 workers on the farm ) and 1 agricultue student from Elmwood College Cupar.There are 5 cottages,4 of which are occupied and one uninhabitable. The basic hours of a farm worker today are 40 hours a week but this obviously fluctuates with the season.A typical worker earns at least Â£75 per week. Near the farmhouse is a 200 years doo'cot which,in Mr.Ostler's father's life time,was used for keeping pigeons.In winter,when only salted pork was available,pigeons provided a welcome change of diet. The family receive deliveries of groceries,paper,milk,etc. and tend to do the rest of their shopping in Cupar.
